thread.title: Exeter fan almost run over after being floored by single punch from fellow supporter after derby loss to Plymouth
thread.title_full: Exeter fan almost run over after being floored by single punch from fellow supporter after derby loss to Plymouth

author: tgannon
title: Exeter fan almost run over after being floored by single punch from fellow supporter after derby loss to Plymouth
text:
EFL Footy fan attack Exeter fan almost run over after being floored by single punch from fellow supporter after derby loss to Plymouth 
Public attack was recorded following the Grecians' 3-0 derby defeat to rivals Plymouth on Saturday By TOBY GANNON 12th February 2017, 3:12 pm THIS is the shocking moment an Exeter fan is almost run over after being punched by a FELLOW supporter. 
The public attack was recorded following the Grecians’ 3-0 derby defeat to Plymouth on Saturday. YouTube 5 An Exeter fan is surrounded by people in the middle of a road after the Plymouth derby defeat 
One fan, who appears to be picking himself up from the floor while outnumbered, is clattered in the face from behind and sent flying onto the road, forcing an oncoming car to slam on the breaks. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
The vehicle stops just inches short of his head and the stricken supporter is down for a couple of seconds before he can get up. 
While he regains his composure, his attacker – and the rest of those involved – flee the scene. 
A man arrives who shouts at the group: “F***ing three people! There’s three of you!” YouTube One fellow supporters rushes him from behind and clatters him in the face YouTube The Exeter fan is sent sprawling onto the middle of the road, forcing a car to suddenly break Related Stories Magic of the Cup Hundreds of Sutton United fans queue from 5am at Gander Green Lane to get their hands on tickets for FA Cup clash against Arsenal Bottoms up Corby Town's Jason Lee celebrated the winner against Mickleover Sports in style... by taking a swig of a fan's pint Football tragedy Amateur footballer who tragically died on the pitch named as popular English teacher James Moorcroft 'Shameful' Luca Toni blasts gang of thugs who 'attacked car he and club president were riding in' as he tells terrifying tale Bak to Business Chelsea and Man Utd handed huge transfer boost as Monaco star Tiemoue Bakayoko rejects new contract 
Eyewitnesses claim the brawl broke out amongst Exeter fans in front of children and families after they left Home Park, according to the Plymouth Herald . 
The incident followed a vital derby clash which was marred by ugly off-the-ball scenes. 
Fans and police clashed at Argyle’s stadium and pint glasses were allegedly launched at cops. 
A flare was set off in the city centre which officers needed to duck out the way off. A local pub was then evacuated. YouTube The dazed fan was missed by a matter of inches by the oncoming car YouTube 5 The supporter gets back up after his attacker flees the scene 
Facebook user Gail Cameron-Clarke wrote: “We got caught up in it. Sat having breakfast in Wetherspoons and suddenly they all came in Wetherspoons. 
“Was awful. Throwing pint glasses at the police inside the pub. We had my little nephew with us, didn’t finish breakfast, had to leave. 
“Awful, don’t think they are fans, more like hooligans.” 
Police did not confirm how many arrests were made that day.
